guide.title: adventurers_guide3_asmo
guide.message:
Greetings. You may not know me, but you will soon enough. Perhaps I can offer some advice? Take or leave it as you will, but either way, I suggest you listen. You may already know that you can rest to regain lost health, but there are also healing items that can restore additional health as time passes. That gets you back in the hunt much quicker! Try one sometime, and see for yourself. In the meantime, try speaking to Kaindal at Aldelle Village--he might have some work for you.



Until next time,



~A friend

guide.title: adventurers_guide4_asmo
guide.message:
So try as they might, the shackles of your past cannot hold you any longer. Know that the Asmodians know your name. Know that you are one of us. Know that we are one with you. We are kin.



Walk strong. Let blood boil within your veins, and use the steel of our spirit to strengthen your conviction. The cowards will fall before you like Elyos flowers under Asmodian rain.



Blood for blood!



A friend.

guide.title: adventurers_guide5_asmo
guide.message:
So try as they might, the shackles of your past cannot hold you any longer. Know that the Asmodians know your name. Know that you are one of us. Know that we are one with you. We are kin.



Walk strong. Let blood boil within your veins, and use the steel of our spirit to strengthen your conviction. The cowards will fall before you like Elyos flowers under Asmodian rain.

guide.message:
So try as they might, the shackles of your past cannot hold you any longer. Know that the Asmodians know your name. Know that you are one of us. Know that we are one with you. We are kin.



Walk strong. Let blood boil within your veins, and use the steel of our spirit to strengthen your conviction. The cowards will fall before you like Elyos flowers under Asmodian rain.



Blood for blood!



A friend.

guide.title: adventurers_guide7_asmo
guide.message:
Have you met Devalin near Anturoon Crossing and Nalto near Dubaro Vine Canyon They have tasks that you should take. As you have probably figured out by now, healing items come in many forms. Some instantly restore your health, others restore it over time. Some affect magical capacity, and some affect both health and mana. Keep that in mind. By now, we may have already met. From this time frame, I can't be sure...I apologize, this must be confusing. I will sign off for now.



Until next time,



~A friend
guide.select: What on Atreia is he talking about?

guide.title: adventurers_guide8_asmo
guide.message:
So try as they might, the shackles of your past cannot hold you any longer. Know that the Asmodians know your name. Know that you are one of us. Know that we are one with you. We are kin.



Walk strong. Let blood boil within your veins, and use the steel of our spirit to strengthen your conviction. The cowards will fall before you like Elyos flowers under Asmodian rain.



Blood for blood!



A friend.

guide.title: adventurers_guide10_asmo
guide.message:
I should hope you've figured out who I am by now. But if not... well, as I said, manipulating time can be confusing. Congratulations on becoming a Daeva! Keep your wits about you, and don't give in to the addlepated politics of Pandaemonium! Now that you have earned your wings, I suggest you look into the world beyond Ishalgen; many rewards will become available!



A vast road is now available to you. I look forward to seeing how you travel it.



Until next time,



~A friend (aka Munin)

guide.title: adventurers_guide64_asmo
guide.message: Congratulations!

guide.title: adventurers_guide13_asmo
guide.message:
I'll get right to the point this time: Nerhel Gilungk of Basfelt Village has a problem and will reward you handsomely should you choose to assist. Perhaps you could use some medicine for the journey? Just a suggestion.



Before I forget to ask, have you encountered Enchantment Stones yet? Daevas use them to make their weapons and armor more powerful. You might want to look for them next time you're near a Trade Broker. You can also draw Enchantment Stones from weapons and armor you don't need by using Extraction Tools bought from any General Goods Merchant. Just remember that the item is destroyed in the process!



I hope you remember who's been helping you when the time comes.... I will need your aid soon enough! Make destiny yours!



Until next time,



~Munin

~Munin.

Blood for blood!

guide.title: adventurers_guide20_asmo
guide.message:
Ah, Stigmas! Such a useful tool. Yes, they're ripped from the souls of displaced Daevas, but don't brood over that part. Rejoice instead that you gain abilities that one on your path might never otherwise obtain.



You are now ready to walk that particular path, my friend. Take these scrolls, and use them to quicken your return to Pandaemonium. Once there, you would do well to speak with Aud and Vergelmir in the Capitol Building. They know more about Stigmas than anyone else I've met.



Until next time,



~Munin
guide.select: Stigmas, eh? Should check those out.

guide.title: adventurers_guide37_asmo
guide.message: Congratulations!

guide.title: adventurers_guide38_asmo
guide.message:
Do you remember the storm I spoke of last time I contacted you? It is here. And, like all powerful storms, this one is multi-faceted and deadly.



I trust you have found your way to Kromede's Trial? If not, hurry to Beluslan Fortress and speak to Nerita as soon as you can. Kromede's Trial will open your eyes to some cold, hard Asmodian truths, while the treasures to be found there are easily worth your time. However, other areas are also ready for your attention, including Alukina's Palace (though you must first fix the Anair Lighthouse), the Mist Mane Village, and the Lower Abyss Fortresses.



Choose your destiny, my friend! The branches, these choices, are merely a glimpse of life as a Daeva unshackled from the chains of destiny!



Until next time,



~Munin

guide.title: adventurers_guide39_asmo
guide.message:

Blood for blood!



~Munin.

guide.title: adventurers_guide40.2_asmo
guide.message:
So you heve survived this far. I excepted you to, but i did not expect you to reach these heights quite so quickly. I am impressed, my friend! But, with each surpassed milestone comes a slew of fresh challenges.



A ship known as the Steel Rake is careering through the skies above as you read this. Its Shulack crew don't care for either Elyos or Asmodians, and kidnap and torture you kin on a daily basis. Stop them. Alternatively, you are now ready to finish up your work in Morheim or take on the Lower Abyss Treasure Rooms.



But combat isn't all that's available for you now, no! New skills are ready to be unlocked, and you are now ready to undertake the expert test in a profession of your choosing.



Blood for blood!



~Munin

guide.title: adventurers_guide41_asmo
guide.message:
So try as they might, the shackles of your past cannot hold you any longer. Know that the Asmodians know your name. Know that you are one of us. Know that we are one with you. We are kin.



Walk strong. Let blood boil within your veins, and use the steel of our spirit to strengthen your conviction. The cowards will fall before you like Elyos flowers under Asmodian rain.



Blood for blood!



~Munin.

guide.title: adventurers_guide43_asmo
guide.message:
It was always inevitable. Your progress was too fast, too unique, not to eventually garner the attention of certain groups within Asmodian society. Complete your work in the Abyss, and you will be summoned, brought into a new world.



Perhaps now would be a good time to revisit the Draupnir Cave, too If memory serves me correctly, there are opportunities there that will grant you rather powerful armor items....






~Munin

guide.title: adventurers_guide44.1_asmo
guide.message:
So try as they might, the shackles of your past cannot hold you any longer. Know that the Asmodians know your name. Know that you are one of us. Know that we are one with you. We are kin.



Walk strong. Let blood boil within your veins, and use the steel of our spirit to strengthen your conviction. The cowards will fall before you like Elyos flowers under Asmodian rain.



Blood for blood!



A friend.

guide.title: adventurers_guide44.2_asmo
guide.message:
Savor these moments, friend. This is the calm before the storm, an opportunity for you to gather your thoughts and your strength before destiny's grasp again finds you. Soon the halls of Kromede's Trial will be open for you to explore; soon you will walk in the shoes of the poor woman you so brutally butchered in the Fire Temple, and realize how she came to be known as Morheim's most corrupt judge. Soon, but not now.



I also see the potential for you to unlock further Divine Point skills! As you no doubt know, these are some of the most powerful skills in your arsenal.



I will contact you again soon. Be prepared.



~Munin
guide.select: I will do as you ask.

guide.title: adventurers_guide45_asmo
guide.message:
So try as they might, the shackles of your past cannot hold you any longer. Know that the Asmodians know your name. Know that you are one of us. Know that we are one with you. We are kin.



Walk strong. Let blood boil within your veins, and use the steel of our spirit to strengthen your conviction. The cowards will fall before you like Elyos flowers under Asmodian rain.



Blood for blood!



~Munin.

guide.title: adventurers_guide46_asmo
guide.message:
No doubt you've heard of the Dredgion, even if you've not seen it yet. It is a vile creation, a Balaur warship that fills all with dread. I remember fighting the Dredgion for years... every time my legion would grow smaller and smaller. But now we know how to defeat it. You're ready to try, friend.



You're also ready to enter the Adma Stronghold, and fight against the undead fiends that occupy it's rotting halls. Lord Lannock is a terrifying creature, a man so powerful that even the shackles of death cannot restrain him. You cannot defeat him alone; bring allies. Lots of allies.



Be safe, my child. I will be watching you.



Until next time,



~Munin

guide.title: adventurers_guide48_asmo
guide.message:
One good thing about this cell of mine is that I'm given plenty of time to concentrate on making my little trinkets and gifts for those of you I like. I've made this for you. While you're checking it over, why not head over to the BuBu Village and do some quests for those little furry creatures?



Until next time,



~Munin

guide.title: adventurers_guide50_asmo_sin
guide.message:
You have made it! You have ascended to the original high ranking of the Asmodian order. You have, no doubt, mastered the lands of Asmodae and the Abyss, but this is far from the end.

Balaurea awaits you, drenched in wonder and pure evil. Please take these rewards as a token of congratulations thus far on your journey, but you will need them!

On behalf of the entire Server staff, enjoy the rewards. Please recommend us!

guide.title: adventurers_guide50_asmo
guide.message:
Still marching on, aren't we? You've reached an impressive milestone today, my friend. But as before, the Asmodian does not dwell on what he has done, but what there is to do. And there is plenty.



Poeta is a region of the sun-filled Elyos lands. It is a serene place, a pedestal on which many Elyos Daevas find their wings. But there is a second version of Poeta too, which is not of our time. This place, Dark Poeta, can be accessed now. Speak with Kaoranerk if you're interested. Alternatively, you can enter the Adma Stronghold again and earn yourself some of the finest wings I know of. Then there is another land entirely for you to explore: Balaurea. It has only recently been discovered, so there is plenty of work to be done there. Similarly, our scientists have found a new artifact floating within a gargantuan chunk of Aether in the Abyss. This place is known as the Abyssal Splinter, and can be entered provided we have control of the Divine Fortress. However, the challenge there is unlike anything you will have faced before. Be safe.



Then there are other tasks you can engage in, such as unlocking further Stigma slots, or gaining mastery in your chosen craft profession! So much to do... at least you don't have to worry about running out of time, hey?



As ever, I have something for you! Thank me later.



~Munin

guide.title: adventurers_guide55_asmo
guide.message:
Pinnacle is a strange word to me. Others use it with reckless abandon; "This staff is the pinnacle of my work", for example. I don't believe in pinnacles; I believe in progress. Do not think your work is done, because there is still much to do. Beshmundir Temple awaits you, while Gelkmaros and Inggison hold two of the most powerful creatures known to us: Padmarashka and Sematariux, the twin terrors. You may well find them, but defeating them will require your very best efforts, and your very best allies. You'll see.



At this point you should also look to unlock the last of your Stigma slots. Only at that point will you be able to reach your true potential.



Good luck. You will need it.

guide.title: adventurers_guide56_asmo
guide.message: Congratulations!

guide.title: adventurers_guide65_asmo
guide.message: Congratulations!

guide.title: adventurers_guide3_ely
guide.message: Greetings, child. You may not realize this yet, but you are very important to me& and to all Elysea. So I will do my best to help you as you travel these lands. Make your way to Akarios Village. You will find a Bind Point there. And take this with you& it is a gift of sorts for your journey. May Ariel's light protect you...and illuminate your past.

guide.title: adventurers_guide4_ely
guide.message:
Another lesson learned, another table turned. You have done well, my friend. The Seraphim Lords view you as a beacon of hope for the Elyos people, and watch your every step with an ever-increasing sense of pride.

Be well, child. Enjoy the gifts you have been blessed with.

A friend.

guide.title: adventurers_guide5_ely
guide.message:
Young one, you can link yourself to a new Bind Point at Melponeh's Campsite& not too far from here. It is a perilous journey there, so take this with you. It will help you along your journey.



Be well, child.

guide.title: adventurers_guide6_ely
guide.message:
Another lesson learned, another table turned. You have done well, my friend. The Seraphim Lords view you as a beacon of hope for the Elyos people, and watch your every step with an ever-increasing sense of pride.

Be well, child. Enjoy the gifts you have been blessed with.

A friend.

guide.title: adventurers_guide7_ely
guide.message:
Another lesson learned, another table turned. You have done well, my friend. The Seraphim Lords view you as a beacon of hope for the Elyos people, and watch your every step with an ever-increasing sense of pride.

Be well, child. Enjoy the gifts you have been blessed with.

A friend.

guide.title: adventurers_guide8_ely
guide.message:
Greetings, youngling. You have come a long way since you first opened your eyes. I speak to you now because I sense you will soon find your way to the Kabarah Strip Mine and the Agaric Spore Road...and one step closer to your truth. Be wary as well as open, child, for you may meet a familiar face on an unfamiliar road.

Farewell for now.
guide.select: I will be wary and open.

guide.title: adventurers_guide10_ely
guide.message:
As you have no doubt guessed by now, I am Pernos. It has been my privilege to help you along the path to your ultimate truth.



I must commend you on your ascension to Daeva, child. You have faced many more perilous quests than most Elyos. But now it is time for you to learn the ancient civilization of the Elyos in the Protector's Hall of Sanctum. Those teachings will serve you well in your journey.



In honor of your ascension, I bestow upon you this gift.



~Pernos

guide.title: adventurers_guide64_ely
guide.message: Congratulations!

guide.title: adventurers_guide13_ely
guide.message:
I'll get right to the point this time: Tolbas Village has a problem and will reward you handsomely should you choose to assist. Perhaps you could use some medicine for the journey? Just a suggestion.



Before I forget to ask, have you encountered Enchantment Stones yet? Daevas use them to make their weapons and armor more powerful. You might want to look for them next time you're near a Trade Broker. You can also draw Enchantment Stones from weapons and armor you don't need by using Extraction Tools bought from any General Goods Merchant. Just remember that the item is destroyed in the process!



I hope you remember who's been helping you when the time comes.... I will need your aid soon enough! Make destiny yours!



Until next time,



~Pernon

guide.title: adventurers_guide14_ely
guide.message:
Daeva, I have admired your courage since you were sent to me. For your deeds to this point, you deserve another reward. Let it aid you as we bring peace to Atreia once and for all!

~Spatalos

guide.title: adventurers_guide17.1_ely
guide.message:
Daeva, the task ahead of you get no less challenging.

The Tursin Garrison & Cantas Coast withstand the most threatening beings to date. Be careful out there as you travel these lands. Look to guidance in the Observatory should you ever need it. ~Spatalos

guide.title: adventurers_guide17.2_ely
guide.message:
Daeva, the task ahead of you get no less challenging.

The Tursin Garrison & Cantas Coast withstand the most threatening beings to date. Be careful out there as you travel these lands. Look to guidance in the Observatory should you ever need it. ~Spatalos

guide.title: adventurers_guide18_ely
guide.message: Congratulations!

guide.title: adventurers_guide19_ely
guide.message: Congratulations!

guide.title: adventurers_guide20_ely
guide.message: Congratulations!

guide.title: adventurers_guide22_ely
guide.message:
You are ascending as we all expected, Deava. However, be on the lookout. You may be hunted down by our enemy race, the Asmodians in all parts of Eltnen.

Please be prepared, you are only three levels away from exploring a world beyond your own; unlike any you have seen before.

guide.title: adventurers_guide32_ely
guide.message:
I trust you've heard of Tigraki Island by now? It is a secret place, hidden far from sight and visited by so few. You can now go there and work with the resident Shugo creatures. They will undoubtedly reward you well for your time. While you're there you'll have ample opportunity to expand your cube space, too. Oh, you may want to make sure you have plenty of flight potions for your journey. I have heard of countless Daevas falling to their death on the way.



Another gift for you! Use it well.



~Pernos

guide.title: adventurers_guide50_ely_sin
guide.message:
You have made it! You have ascended to the original high ranking of the Elyos order. You have, no doubt, mastered the lands of Elysea and the Abyss, but this is far from the end.

Balaurea awaits you, drenched in wonder and pure evil. Please take these rewards as a token of congratulations thus far on your journey, but you will need them!

On behalf of the entire Server staff, enjoy the rewards. Please recommend us!

guide.title: adventurers_guide52_ely
guide.message: Congratulations!

guide.title: adventurers_guide55_ely
guide.message:
The summit has been reached! My sincerest congratulations, my child. You have blossomed from a mere seed into the grandest of trees, and now stand shoulder to shoulder with the most feared and respected names in all of Elysea! My pride is immeasurable, but to sit here and rest easy now would be a crime. There is much to do, for this great war is still not won, and Elysea needs its best now more than ever before.



The great halls of Beshmundir Temple have swung open to you. This place will trouble you more than anything you've faced before. Perhaps you would be best off first unlocking the last of your Stigma potential? Hmm....



Elsewhere, two mighty beasts are ready to be tackled. No doubt you have already heard of Sematariux and Padmarashka, ancient drakan that failed to ascend to the ranks of the Dragon Lords, but who still command immense power. You could try fighting them, but be warned... no-one I know of has succeeded yet.



One mountain has been climbed my child, but there is still much to do. Faith and arms!



~Pernos

guide.title: adventurers_base1
guide.message:
Adventurer's Base"

Nearly there, friend. Destiny beckons just one more step, and then a lifetime of opportunity will be opened up to you! Balaurea... but no, you are not there yet.



Keep struggling against our enemies. Fight harder than ever before. Then you'll unlock everything. Even access to the much lauded Miragent armor set.



Blood for blood!



~Admin
guide.select: Have Fun and Enjoy on EA!

guide.title: adventurers_base2
guide.message:
Adventurer's Base"

Nearly there, friend. Destiny beckons just one more step, and then a lifetime of opportunity will be opened up to you! ArchDaeva... but no, you are not there yet.



Keep struggling against our enemies. Fight harder than ever before. Then you'll unlock everything.



Blood for blood!



~Admin
guide.select: Have Fun and Enjoy on EA!

guide.title: adventurers_base3
guide.message:
Adventurer's Base"

Still marching on, aren't we ? You've reached an impressive milestone today, my friend. But as before, the Asmodian does not dwell on what he has done, but what there is to do. And there is plenty.



Panesterra was once the domain of the ancient Danuar. The cataclysmic explosion that destroyed Kaldor was so powerful that the fabric of reality was ripped apart, and Panesterra vanished into another dimension. Desperate to return home, the Danuar that were pulled with it gathered as much Ide as they could muster, but the plan backfired; instead of returning home, the land bent and split, becoming nothing more than islands floating in a void. Now, with the power of the Linkgate Foundry, Beritra has invaded Panesterra, intent on exploiting its secrets.



Panesterra sieges will be open periodically. -Entrances become available in the Hall of Fame and Walk of Fame areas at the appointed time and remain spawned for ten minutes, or until all spots are filled



As ever, I have something for you! Thank me later.



~Admin
guide.select: Have Fun and Enjoy on EA!
